author: pepesza.eth
content: Question about lobby and "TryContributeError::AnotherContributionInProgress". The idea is to retry until sequencer allows you to participate? Or is lobby a form of managed queue?

author: bridge-bot
content: <CarlBeek> the lobby is not a queue, you are correct that you need to keep trying & pinging

author: pepesza.eth
content: Trying to use chotto (java client) and erlang client I'm writing. Both get AnotherContributionInProgress answer from https://kzg-ceremony-sequencer-dev.fly.dev/. All while lobby size is 0 or 1. Is sequencer stuck by any chance?

author: wackerow
content: <@550420431744794624> <https://github.com/zkparty/trusted-setup-frontend/pull/64> Just updated the FAQ PR using the tags that will enable it to work with translations. If you'd like to update this PR directly with any copy changes you're looking to make, just follow the format in the `pages/faq.tsx` file. Otherwise you can just send me the raw and I can update it.

author: wackerow
content: <@992497067878518875> In the meantime, <@293496799854067712> is going to put up a PR that adds a simple `yarn extract` script that can be used again once the FAQ content and everything else is finalized. From there we'll have an English JSON file we can send off for translations.

author: wackerow
content: Also <@992497067878518875>, getting errors related to `node-polyfill-webpack-plugin` when loading up the `main` branch, looks like this may be related to some recent changes?

author: nicoserranop
content: Yes! <@293496799854067712> told me about it. It is related to a new webpack configuration I setup for the wallet providers. Could you try deleting the `node_modules` and running `npm install` again?

author: bridge-bot
content:
<nicoserranop> Hey! quick question: the `oidc.signinwithethereum.org` server is out of our control right? We need to add an error message when user tries to login in without being in the Ethereum Mainnet. I know where is it but we might need to contact the repo owners (spruceid).

Meanwhile, I could add a "check you are in the Ethereum Mainnet network" in our frontend.
